result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Prior: 1212 N. 3rd Street, Wausau, WI 54403

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 3:34 pm 
INCLUDES 14CF746, 14CF1058, AND 15CF661. 
State appears by ADA Desiree Toldt; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Erik Mcfarland. 

State moves to: In 15CF661: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants. 

Argument by the State. 
M.W. makes statement. 
Atty Mcfarland makes corrections to PSI. 
Argument by Atty Mcfarland. 

COURT makes findings. 
COURT ORDERS: In 14CF746: Ct. 1>>SWH for 3 years probation to run consecutive to sentence in 14CF1058 - CONDITIONS: AODA; absolute sobriety; pay restitution as reflected in order; fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the two or if not, 5 hours community service per week; letter of apology to D.A; No contact with D.A; court costs. 
                                                 : Ct. 2>>90 days MCJ to run concurrent to sentence in 14CF1058.  
                           : In 14CF1058: Ct. 2>>38 months WI State Prison System -  20 months IC and 18 months ES - with 50 days credit to run concurrent to all other sentences except for Ct. 1 in 14CF746  - provide DNA sample 
                                                   : Ct. 3>>9 months MCJ - to run concurrent with 50 days credit. 
COURT notes restitution is number 1 priority and court costs maybe remitted at later date. 
COURT finds the def is eligible for SAP and NOT eligible for CIP. 
Adj: 4:14 pm

Pre-trial conference at 08-06-2015 08:20 am.
Preliminary Hearing at 08-10-2015 09:30 am.
Final pre-trial at 08-27-2015 08:10 am.
